title.narrative: 5. EDUCATION IN EMERGENCIES

description.narrative: By 2022, girls and boys aged 3 to 17 affected by emergencies in the Sahel, East, North, Center-North and Boucle du Mouhoun regions have access to a safe, protective and quality learning environment that contributes to their development, protection, and psychosocial well-being, which contributes to Access To Quality Learning Opportunities, Access To Quality Learning Opportunities (Covid), Learning, Skills, Participation And Engagement, Learning, Skills, Participation And Engagement (Covid). UNICEF aims to achieve this through Advocacy And Public Engagement, Community Engagement, Social And Behaviour Change, Developing And Leveraging Resources And Partnerships, Evaluations, Research And Data, Fostering Innovation And Use Of New Technologies, Operational Support To Programme Delivery, Systems Strengthening And Institution Building, Systems Strengthening To Leave No One Behind, United Nations Working Together. This contributes to the following Country Programme result: By 2022, communities have a greater demand for inclusive, equitable, quality pre-primary, primary, post-primary and informal education, especially for children living with disabilities, girls and out-of-school children, and in particular in the Sahel and East regions including in emergency situations.

condition.narrative: Should contribute directly to results for children as outlined in the UNDAF, national results and/or UNICEF Strategic Plan and within the scope defined in the CPD, CPAP, OMP or other agreed upon programme documents

title.narrative: By 2022, girls and boys aged 3 to 17 affected by emergencies in the Sahel, East, North, Center-North and Boucle du Mouhoun regionshave access to a safe, protective and quality learning environment that contributes to their development, protection, andpsychosocial well-being

description.narrative: In 2021 UNICEF in Burkina Faso continued to support MENAPLN and communities affected by insecurity to improve access for school-age children to inclusive, quality education in a protective environment as well as alternative educational opportunities through the National Education in Emergencies Strategy 2019-2024 (Stratégie SN-ESU 2019-2024) and the Humanitarian Response Plan 2021. UNICEF has supported formal and non-formal educational opportunities for 118,535 children (girls 57,152 - 48.2%) and ensured access to continued education through radio programmes to 607,217 children (girls 293,848 - 48.3%). | Status:On-track | As-of Date:11/01/2022
